Crimes.Dispute_Type: Election appeal jurisdiction and procedural fairness
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Jurisdiction of Appeal Committee and procedural fairness
Crimes.Procedural_Stage: Judicial review after Appeal Committee decision
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Applicant failed to provide evidence and did not object during hearing
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On Applicant to demonstrate lack of jurisdiction or breach
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Failure to object at first opportunity undermines claim
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Appeal Committee has jurisdiction over 'additional election procedures' under EPA s.1(a)
Crimes.Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness for jurisdiction, correctness for procedural fairness
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Waiver of procedural fairness due to failure to object
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Dispute over 2009 by-election as continuation of 2006 General Election
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: No breach; objection not raised timely
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Evidence from Wilson Appeal used in Simpson Appeal
Crimes.Legal_Framework: EPA and principles of administrative law
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Appeal Committee lacked jurisdiction and breached fairness
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Not explicitly stated, but procedural waiver applied
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of Appeal Committee decision
Crimes.Jurisdiction: Federal Court over Appeal Committee decisions
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Interpretation of 'additional election procedures' in EPA

Crimes.Crime_Name: Corrupt practice in connection with an election
Crimes.Crime_Type: Human Rights Violations and Serious International Law Offenses
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Events from 2006 election forming basis of corrupt practices finding
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review to overturn guilty finding
Crimes.Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness for jurisdiction, correctness for procedural fairness
Crimes.Evidence_Requirement: Sufficient evidence from prior proceedings accepted
Crimes.Institutional_Action: Appeal Committee found Applicant guilty of corrupt practices
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Records from Wilson Appeal and 2006 election
Crimes.Jurisdiction: Appeal Committee had jurisdiction over by-election as continuation
Crimes.Role_of_Person: Applicant found guilty of corrupt practices
Crimes.State_Protection_Assessment: Adequate through appeal and review mechanisms
Crimes.Credibility: Diminished by failure to raise objections timely
Crimes.Enforcement_Action: Finding of corrupt practices by Appeal Committee
Crimes.Legal_Basis: Violation of election laws constituting corrupt practice
